section_description: This section provides hands-on practice with Python variables and data types. Students will work through interactive coding exercises and real-world examples to solidify their understanding of variable declaration, data type operations, and best practices for using variables in Python programs.
learning_objectives: Students will be able to declare and assign variables using valid Python syntax
Students will be able to distinguish between and use Python's core data types (int, float, str, bool)
Students will be able to perform type conversion between data types
Students will be able to implement variables in practical coding scenarios
Students will be able to diagnose and fix common variable-related errors

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will create and manipulate variables using assignment operations
key_topics: Variable naming rules (letters, numbers, underscores, no keywords)
Printing variable values using print() function

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create three variables (name, age, is_student) with appropriate values and print each one
Assign a value to a variable, then reassign it to a different type and verify the change using print()
Create two variables with different values and swap their contents using a temporary variable

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will perform operations on integers, floats, strings, and booleans
key_topics: Data type coercion in mixed operations

exercises.exercise_instructions: Write a program that declares variables of each core type and prints their data types
Perform operations that mix integers and floats, then explain the resulting data types
Take user input, store it in a variable, and display it with a formatted message

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will convert between data types using built-in functions
key_topics: Using int(), float(), str(), and bool() functions

exercises.exercise_instructions: Convert a user-input string to integer, then to float, and display the results
Test how different values convert to boolean using the bool() function
Write code that attempts to convert invalid input to numeric types and handles the errors gracefully

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will create and manipulate lists and dictionaries for complex data storage

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create a list of groceries, modify elements, and add/remove items from the list
Build a dictionary containing student details and demonstrate accessing/modifying values
Create a list of 10 numbers and demonstrate different slicing techniques to extract sublists

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will implement industry-standard variable naming and usage patterns

exercises.exercise_instructions: Improve a provided code snippet by renaming variables to follow PEP8 guidelines
Convert magic numbers in a program to named constants and demonstrate the improvement
Write code that demonstrates global vs local variable scope and document the behavior
